FuncDef:
The enable command enables the Open Programmability System (OPS) function.
The undo enable command disables the OPS function.
By default, the OPS function is enabled.
Examples: Warning: The operation will stop ops function, all running ops services will be terminated. Continue? [Y/N]:Y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The OPS provides application programming interfaces (APIs) that allow users or third-party developers to program, develop, and deploy customized network applications. The OPS also supports embedded third-party applications and an event subscription mechanism.
The OPS allows users or third-party developers to use its basic functions to program, develop, and deploy customized network applications, helping service extension, automatic configuration, and intelligent management on the device running the OPS and reducing operation and maintenance costs and complexity.
